text: Jerub Baal (that is, Gideon) and his men got up the next morning and camped near the spring of Harod. The Midianites were camped north of them near the hill of Moreh in the valley.
The Lord said to Gideon, “You have too many men for me to hand Midian over to you. Israel might brag, ‘Our own strength has delivered us.’

<st data-num="06258" class="">Now</st>, <st data-num="07121 04994 0559">announce</st> <st data-num="0241" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">men</st>,<n id="1" /> ‘<st data-num="04310" class="">Whoever</st> is <st data-num="02730" class="">shaking</st> with <st data-num="03373" class="">fear</st><n id="2" /> may <st data-num="07725" class="">turn around</st> and <st data-num="06852" class="">leave</st> <st data-num="02022" class="">Mount</st> <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st>.’”<n id="3" /> <st data-num="06242 08147 0505" class="">Twenty-two thousand</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">men</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="07725 04480">went home</st>;<n id="5" /> <st data-num="06235 0505" class="">10,000</st> <st data-num="07604" class="">remained</st>.

The Lord spoke to Gideon again, “There are still too many men. Bring them down to the water, and I will thin the ranks some more. When I say, ‘This one should go with you,’ pick him to go; when I say, ‘This one should not go with you,’ do not take him.”
So he brought the men down to the water. Then the Lord said to Gideon, “Separate those who lap the water as a dog laps from those who kneel to drink.”

Only <st data-num="07969 03967" class="">300</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">men</st> <st data-num="03952" class="">lapped</st> with their <st data-num="03027" class="">hands</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> their <st data-num="06310" class="">mouths</st>;<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="03605 03499">rest</st> of the <st data-num="05971" class="">men</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="03766 05921 01290">kneeled</st> to <st data-num="08354" class="">drink</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>.
The Lord said to Gideon, “With the 300 men who lapped I will deliver the whole army, and I will hand Midian over to you. The rest of the men should go home.”
The men who were chosen took supplies and their trumpets. Gideon sent all the men of Israel back to their homes; he kept only 300 men. Now the Midianites were camped down below in the valley.
That night the Lord said to Gideon, “Get up! Attack the camp, for I am handing it over to you.

But <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> are <st data-num="03373" class="">afraid</st> to <st data-num="03381" class="">attack</st>, <st data-num="03381" class="">go down</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">with</st> <st data-num="06513" class="">Purah</st> your <st data-num="05288" class="">servant</st>

and <st data-num="08085" class="">listen to</st> <st data-num="04100" class="">what</st> they are <st data-num="01696" class="">saying</st>. <st data-num="0310" class="">Then</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">you</st> will <st data-num="02388" class="">be brave</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="03381" class="">attack</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st>.” So he <st data-num="03381" class="">went down</st> <st data-num="01931" class="">with</st> <st data-num="06513" class="">Purah</st> his <st data-num="05288" class="">servant</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="07097" class="">where</st> the <st data-num="02571 0834">sentries were guarding</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st>.<n id="2" />

Now the <st data-num="04080" class="">Midianites</st>, <st data-num="06002" class="">Amalekites</st>, and the <st data-num="03605 01121">people</st> from the <st data-num="06924" class="">east</st> <st data-num="05307" class="">covered</st> the <st data-num="06010" class="">valley</st> like a <st data-num="07230" class="">swarm</st> of <st data-num="0697" class="">locusts</st>.<n id="1" /> Their <st data-num="01581" class="">camels</st> could <st data-num="0369" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="04557" class="">counted</st>; they were as <st data-num="07230" class="">innumerable</st> as the <st data-num="02344" class="">sand</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="08193 03220">seashore</st>.

When <st data-num="01439" class="">Gideon</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">arrived</st>, he <st data-num="02009" class="">heard</st> a <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="05608" class="">telling</st> <st data-num="07453" class="">another man</st> <st data-num="05608" class="">about</st> a <st data-num="02472" class="">dream</st> he had.<n id="1" /> The man<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="02009" class="">Look</st>! I <st data-num="02492" class="">had</st> a <st data-num="02472" class="">dream</st>. I <st data-num="02009" class="">saw</st><n id="3" /> a <st data-num="06742" class="">stale cake</st> of <st data-num="08184" class="">barley</st> <st data-num="03899" class="">bread</st> <st data-num="02015" class="">rolling</st> into the <st data-num="04080" class="">Midianite</st> <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st>. It <st data-num="0935 05704 05221">hit</st> a <st data-num="0168" class="">tent</st> so hard it <st data-num="05307" class="">knocked</st> it <st data-num="05307" class="">over</st> and <st data-num="02015" class="">turned</st> it <st data-num="04605" class="">upside down</st>. The <st data-num="0168" class="">tent</st> just <st data-num="05307" class="">collapsed</st>.”<n id="4" />
The other man said, “Without a doubt this symbolizes the sword of Gideon son of Joash, the Israelite. God is handing Midian and all the army over to him.”
When Gideon heard the report of the dream and its interpretation, he praised God. Then he went back to the Israelite camp and said, “Get up, for the Lord is handing the Midianite army over to you!”

He <st data-num="02673" class="">divided</st> the <st data-num="07969 03967" class="">300</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> into <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="07218" class="">units</st>.<n id="1" /> He <st data-num="05414 03027">gave</st> them <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="07782" class="">trumpets</st> and <st data-num="07386" class="">empty</st> <st data-num="03537" class="">jars</st> with <st data-num="03940" class="">torches</st> <st data-num="08432" class="">inside</st> <st data-num="03537" class="">them</st>.<n id="2" />

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> them, “<st data-num="04480 07200">Watch</st> me and <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> <st data-num="03651" class="">as</st> I <st data-num="03651" class="">do</st>. <st data-num="02009" class="">Watch closely</st>!<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> am <st data-num="0935" class="">going</st> to the <st data-num="07097" class="">edge</st> of the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st>. <st data-num="03651 06213">Do</st> <st data-num="01961 0834">as</st> I <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st>!
When I and all who are with me blow our trumpets, you also blow your trumpets all around the camp. Then say, ‘For the Lord and for Gideon!’”
Gideon took 100 men to the edge of the camp at the beginning of the middle watch, just after they had changed the guards. They blew their trumpets and broke the jars they were carrying.
All three units blew their trumpets and broke their jars. They held the torches in their left hand and the trumpets in their right. Then they yelled, “A sword for the Lord and for Gideon!”

They <st data-num="05975" class="">stood</st> <st data-num="0376 08478">in order</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05439" class="">all around</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st>. The <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> Midianite<n id="2" /> <st data-num="04264" class="">army</st> <st data-num="07323" class="">ran away</st>; they <st data-num="07321" class="">shouted</st> as they <st data-num="05127" class="">scrambled away</st>.<n id="3" />

When the 300 men blew their trumpets, the Lord caused the Midianites to attack one another with their swords throughout the camp. The army fled to Beth Shittah on the way to Zererah. They went to the border of Abel Meholah near Tabbath.
Israelites from Naphtali, Asher, and Manasseh answered the call and chased the Midianites.

Now Gideon sent messengers throughout the Ephraimite hill country who announced, “Go down and head off the Midianites. Take control of the fords of the streams all the way to Beth Barah and the Jordan River.” When all the Ephraimites had assembled, they took control of the fords all the way to Beth Barah and the Jordan River.

They captured the two Midianite generals, Oreb and Zeeb. They executed Oreb on the rock of Oreb and Zeeb in the winepress of Zeeb. They chased the Midianites and brought the heads of Oreb and Zeeb to Gideon, who was now on the other side of the Jordan River.
